According to the news organizations' lawyer, the documents should be public knowledge unless there is a good reason to withhold them. The action is to determine if Rob Ford is somehow connected to the criminal organizations. The [[Crown attorney|Crown]] asks for a six-month delay in releasing the warrants.{{cite news |work=CBC News |title=Rob Ford scandal prompts court fight over drug, gun warrants |last=Seglins |first=Dave |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/story/2013/07/01/toronto-court-media-project-traveller-warrants-rob-ford-alleged-drug-video.html |date=July 2, 2013}} :*The ''Toronto Star'' separately filed a request to see the information on a search warrant for the Windsor Road house and the apartment in the Dixon Road complex where the alleged video was allegedly stored.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |title=Project Traveller: Police used wire taps in guns sweep |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/crime/2013/07/02/project_traveller_police_used_wire_taps_in_guns_sweep.html |date=July 2, 2013 |last=Pagliaro |first=Jennifer}} The court ruled that documents relating to the search warrants will stay sealed until August 27. At that time, lawyers for the media companies will be allowed to review the documents except for sections that the Crown will keep secret. The documents will become public on September 12 after arguments over the secret sections.{{Cite news|newspaper = Toronto Star|date = July 2, 2013|title = Project Traveller: Search warrant information in gang sweep to stay secret until after Aug. 27|last = Pagliaro|first = Jennifer|url = https://www.thestar.com/news/crime/2013/07/02/project_traveller_police_used_wire_taps_in_guns_sweep.html}} *'''July 9''' Muhammad Khattak is released on bail. He was charged in the Project Traveller raids for allegedly dealing drugs and had been held without bail. The reasons for releasing Khattak are protected under a publication ban, but his lawyer stated that Khattak is only 19, does not have a criminal record and has strict stay-at-home conditions. His case, on charges his lawyer characterized as "minor," could take up to 18 months to come to trial.{{cite news |newspaper=The Globe and Mail |title=Man identified in Rob Ford photo out on bail |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/man-identified-in-rob-ford-photo-out-on-bail/article13105175/ |date=July 10, 2013 |last=White |first=Patrick |location=Toronto}} *'''July 18''' Gawker announces that it will divide the money it raised to buy the Ford video evenly between four charities: the Somali Canadian Association of Etobicoke, the South Riverdale Community Health Centre, Unison Health and Community Services and the Ontario Regional Addictions Partnership Committee. The gross amount raised was $201,199, which netted $184,782.61 after fees paid to [[Indiegogo]] and [[PayPal]].{{cite news |last=Magi |first=K. |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2013/07/18/gawker_announces_which_charities_are_getting_crackstarter_fundraising_money.html |title=Gawker announces which charities are getting Crackstarter fundraising money |newspaper=Toronto Star |date=July 18, 2013 |accessdate=August 22, 2013}} *'''July 19''' The search warrant of Hanad Mohamed's arrest is unsealed by the [[Ontario Superior Court of Justice|Ontario Superior Court]], revealing that police seized four smartphones and a micro SD card connecting Mohamed to Nisar Hashimi. The contents of these devices will not be revealed until trial.{{cite news |last=White |first=Patrick |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/search-warrant-sheds-light-on-murder-of-alleged-drug-dealer-seen-in-photo-rob-ford/article13330850/ |title=Search warrant sheds light on murder of alleged drug dealer seen in photo with Rob Ford |newspaper=The Globe and Mail |date=July 19, 2013 |accessdate=August 22, 2013 |location=Toronto}} *'''July 26''' Crown prosecutors drop first degree murder charges against Hanad Mohamed. He is now charged with accessory after the fact to manslaughter, accessory to discharging a firearm and accessory to aggravated assault on Muhammad Khattak.{{cite news |last=Powell |first=Betsy |date=July 26, 2013 |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/crime/2013/07/26/crown_drops_murder_charge_in_anthony_smith_case_against_hanad_mohamed.html |title=Crown drops murder charge in Anthony Smith case against Hanad Mohamed |newspaper=Toronto Star |accessdate=July 30, 2013}} *'''July 30''' Monir Kassim is granted bail and released from detention.{{cite news |work=Metro News |location=Toronto |last=Poisson |first=Jayme |url=http://metronews.ca/news/toronto/753438/monir-kassim-man-in-photo-with-mayor-rob-ford-released-on-bail/ |title=Monir Kassim, man in photo with Mayor Rob Ford, released on bail |date=July 30, 2012 |accessdate=August 22, 2013}} ===August to September=== *'''August 2''' The ''Toronto Star'' reports that Mohamed Siad, one of the men who showed the alleged video to reporters, was one of the people arrested in the Project Traveller raids. The ''Toronto Sun ''reports that Siad had been stabbed while in custody by alleged gang members who blamed him for causing the Project Traveller raids. It also reports that Siad had offered to turn the video over to police in return for dropping charges against him.{{cite news |last1=Pizzano |first1=Sam |last2=Peat |first2=Don |url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/08/02/man-stabbed-over-alleged-rob-ford-crack-video |title=Man stabbed over alleged Rob Ford crack video |newspaper=Toronto Sun |date=August 2, 2013}} *'''August 7''' Mohamed Siad, Monir Kassim and Muhammad Khattak appear in court to set trial dates. Siad remains in jail while Kassim and Khattak are out on bail until trial.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |title=Rob Ford crack scandal: Man who tried to sell video appears in court |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2013/08/07/rob_ford_crack_scandal_man_who_tried_to_sell_video_appears_in_court.html |first=Jayme |last=Poisson |date=August 7, 2013}} *'''August 8''' City Hall confirms that "special assistant" Carley McNeil no longer works in Ford's office as an events co-ordinator. The ''Toronto Star'' reports that three sources say she was fired. She is the eighth staff member to have left since the video scandal became public.{{cite news |last=Moloney |first=Paul |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2013/08/08/mayor_rob_ford_loses_another_staffer_from_his_office.html |title=Mayor Rob Ford loses another staffer from his office |newspaper=Toronto Star |date=August 8, 2013 |accessdate=August 8, 2013}} *'''August 12''' ''The Globe and Mail ''reports that Ford attempted to visit an inmate in the [[Toronto West Detention Centre]], Bruno Bellissimo, in March, after visiting hours. The newspaper calls Bellissimo a "new character" in the video scandal, who has been involved in drugs and attended secondary school with one of the residents of the Rexdale bungalow where Ford was photographed.{{cite news |last=Senger |first=Emily |url=http://www2.macleans.ca/2013/08/12/rob-ford-roundup-party-on-the-danforth-and-a-new-character-emerges/ |title=Rob Ford roundup: Party on the Danforth and ‘a new character’ emerges |work=Maclean's |date=August 12, 2013}} *'''August 15 ''' ''Toronto Sun ''columnist [[Warren Kinsella]] claims that the crack video was obtained by police via the Project Traveller raids and has been viewed by "many, many Toronto defence lawyers."{{cite news |newspaper=Torontoist |title=Duly Quoted: Warren Kinsella |url=http://torontoist.com/2013/08/duly-quoted-warren-kinsella/ |first=Steve |last=Kupferman |date=August 15, 2013}} *'''August 17''' Toronto Police interview five former staffers in Rob Ford's office about Alessandro "Sandro" Lisi, a private driver for the mayor, allegedly being investigated in an attempt to acquire the video.{{cite news |newspaper=The Globe and Mail |title= Police questioned Ford's former staff about alleged video |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/police-questioned-rob-ford-former-staff-about-alleged-video/article13829088/ |first=Patrick |last=White |date=August 17, 2013 |location=Toronto}} Both Lisi and Bruno Bellissimo were present at the Toronto Garrison Officer's Ball on February 22, an event where Ford was previously accused of being intoxicated.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |title=Police probe Mayor Rob Ford friends who sought crack video |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2013/08/16/police_probe_mayor_rob_ford_friends_who_sought_crack_video.html |first1=Kevin |last1=Donovan | first2= Jayme |last2=Poisson |date=August 16, 2013}} *'''August 20''' The [[Ontario Press Council]] announces it will hold public hearings in September to investigate 41 complaints about the ''Toronto Star'' and ''Globe and Mail'''s reporting during the scandal.{{cite news |work=CBC News |title=Rob Ford crack stories subject of press council complaints |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/story/2013/08/20/toronto-rob-ford-press-council.html |author=The Canadian Press |date=August 20, 2013 |accessdate=August 22, 2013}} * '''August 27''' A 'domestic assault' call at the Ford residence disrupts a police sting involving Lisi. Lisi contacts Ford and does not drive to the sting. Lisi instead goes home, then to the Grand Hotel on Jarvis Street, where Ford has checked in. Ford is observed the next day in the alley behind the Grand Hotel making an exchange with a man on foot, while in his SUV. The alleyway area is known as "crack central" by locals. Ford stays in the hotel for three days.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |date=November 21, 2013 |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2013/11/22/rob_ford_police_investigation_domestic_assault_call_at_ford_home_sidetracked_police_sting.html |title=Rob Ford police investigation: 'Domestic assault' call at Ford home sidetracked police sting |first1=Kevin |last1=Donovan |first2=Kenyon |last2=Wallace}} *'''September 9''' The Ontario Press Council holds hearings on ''Globe'' and ''Star'' stories, with editors [[Michael Cooke]] and [[John Stackhouse (The Globe and Mail)|John Stackhouse]] testifying. The Ford brothers do not attend.{{cite news |work=CBC News |title=Star and Globe defend their Rob and Doug Ford stories|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/star-and-globe-defend-their-rob-and-doug-ford-stories-1.1699053 |date=September 9, 2013 |accessdate=October 10, 2013}} ===October=== *'''October 1''' Sandro Lisi and another man are arrested by police in Etobicoke. Lisi is charged with possession of and trafficking in marijuana, possession of the proceeds of crime and [[conspiracy (criminal)|conspiracy]].{{cite news |work=Toronto Star |title=Mayor Rob Ford’s friend Sandro Lisi, who sought video, one of two arrested in Etobicoke|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2013/10/01/mayor_rob_ford_friend_who_sought_video_among_two_arrested_in_etobicoke.html |first=Kevin |last=Donovan |date=October 2, 2013 |accessdate=October 2, 2013}} The arrest is part of the larger Project Traveller probe.{{cite news |work=The Globe and Mail | author=Patrick White and Glenn McArthur|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/arrest-of-mayor-rob-fords-friend-linked-to-larger-project-traveller-investigation/article14666275/ |title=Arrest of Toronto Mayor Rob Ford's friend part of broader probe |date=October 2, 2013 |accessdate=October 12, 2013}} Charges would later be dismissed May 8, 2015.[https://www.thestar.com/news/crime/2015/05/08/verdict-expected-today-in-drug-trial-for-rob-ford-pal-sandro-lisi.html Hasham, Alyshah (May 8, 2014). "Rob Ford friend Sandro Lisi cleared of all drug charges". ''Toronto Star''. Retrieved January 4, 2016.] * '''October 2''' Doug Ford talks to the ''Toronto Sun'' about the Lisi arrests: "I support the police investigation. I don’t know this guy. Never seen him, never met him — ever." *'''October 7''' A leaked police document links Lisi to an attempt to exchange marijuana for "the return of a cellular phone stolen from an associate" in March 2013.{{cite news |work=Metro News |url=http://metronews.ca/news/toronto/817803/sandro-lisis-hunt-for-rob-fords-alleged-cellphone-sparked-probe/ |title=Sandro Lisi’s hunt for cellphone allegedly belonging to Rob Ford sparked probe |date=October 7, 2013 |author=Staff}} *'''October 16''' ''The Globe and Mail'' and ''Toronto Star'' are fully exonerated by the Ontario Press Council. Doug Ford accuses the agency of being "a bunch of cronies."{{cite news|author=Steve Ladurantaye|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/press-council-rules-globes-use-of-anonymous-sources-in-doug-ford-story-deemed-justifiable/article14882985/ |title=Press Council dismisses complaints against The Globe's Doug Ford investigation; he dismisses the findings |publisher=The Globe and Mail |date=May 22, 2013 |accessdate=October 16, 2013 |location=Toronto}} *'''October 23''' The ''Toronto Star'' reports that the Rexdale bungalow where Ford was photographed was under surveillance by police, and Mohamed Siad, who tried to sell the video to the ''Star'', was observed on several occasions visiting the residence. Police surveillance records also correspond to the date and time of a meeting between Gawker editor John Cook and Siad.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |date=October 24, 2013 |page=A1 |title=Ford photo taken outside what cops call 'drug house' |last1=Poisson |first1=Jayme |last2=Donovan |first2=Kevin}} *'''October 30''' The Ontario Superior Court orders that a 480-page police document that was used to obtain search warrants for Lisi be made public.{{cite news|author=Patrick White, Ann Hui And Greg Mcarthur |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/lawyers-in-court-tuesday-to-press-for-release-of-documents-in-alessandro-lisi-arrest/article15153737/ |title=Evidence that led to the arrest of Rob Ford's friend for drugs to be released this morning |publisher=The Globe and Mail |date= October 31, 2013|accessdate=October 31, 2013 |location=Toronto}} Peter Jacobsen, the lawyer who is representing ''The Globe and Mail'' and other news organizations, notes that the information is "exceptionally long" given the nature of Lisi's charges. [[File:Police Chief Blair Eaton Centre Shooting Toronto 2012.jpg|thumb|right|Chief Blair spoke regarding released documents. He is seen here in June 2012.]] *'''October 31''' Heavily redacted court documents released show that Toronto Police investigated the alleged crack video of Ford and the attempted recovery of the video by Lisi. Surveillance photographs show Ford meeting Lisi in various locations. Ford and Lisi were trailed and monitored by police from March until October 2013, including the use of a Cessna plane after Lisi started using "counter-surveillance" methods to lose police. In the course of the investigation, former mayoral staffer Chris Fickel was interviewed by Toronto Police and suggested that Lisi was the source of marijuana and cocaine for Ford.{{cite news |newspaper=National Post |date=October 31, 2013 |url=http://news.nationalpost.com/2013/10/31/rob-ford-crack-video-the-focus-of-investigation-drug-trafficking-search-warrant-documents-say/ |title=Rob Ford alleged crack video the focus of investigation, drug trafficking search-warrant documents say}} :*'''Police reveal existence of video''' :**In a press conference held after the release of the documents, Toronto Police Chief Blair reveals that the police recovered a copy of the video from the hard drive of a computer seized during the Project Traveller raids. According to Blair, the video's contents are as described in the media reports. Lisi is charged with extortion related to the video and is to appear in Toronto Court later in the day (Lisi's hearing is held the next day). Blair states that the video will come out in court, and that the contents are "disappointing".{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |title=Rob Ford video scandal: Police have the video that appears to show mayor smoking crack, Blair says |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2013/10/31/rob_ford_crack_cocaine_scandal_police_photographed_mayor_in_multiple_meetings_with_alleged_drug_dealer.html |date=October 31, 2013 |accessdate=October 31, 2013}} Lisi tell investigators that Blair "is going to get his." :**At his City Hall office, Ford briefly addressed the media "Everyone has seen the allegations. I wish I could come out and defend myself but I can't. It's before the courts. That's all I can say right now. No reason to resign. I am going to go back and return my phone calls and be out doing what the people elected me to do and that's save taxpayers money and run the great government that we've been running the last three years."{{cite news |work=Global News |url=https://soundcloud.com/jackson-proskow/mayor-ford |title=Mayor Ford |last=Proskow |first=Jason |date=October 31, 2013}} :**Toronto newspapers ''Toronto Sun'', ''The Globe and Mail'', ''National Post'' and the ''Toronto Star'' all call on Ford to resign. A same-day public opinion poll conducted by phone of Torontonians showed that, while 44% approved of the mayoral job Ford was doing, 60% wanted him to resign.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |title=Mayor Rob Ford's approval rating ticks upward with news of crack video |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2013/11/01/mayor_rob_fords_approval_rating_ticks_upward_with_news_of_crack_video.html |date=November 1, 2013}} The news that the video has been found by the police is reported internationally.{{cite news |work=CBC News |url= http://www.cbc.ca/news2/interactives/rob-ford-headlines/ |title=Rob Ford bombshell allegations spur saucy headlines |date=October 31, 2013}} ===November === *'''November 1''' Dennis Morris, Ford's lawyer, appears on various media outlets denying that Ford is smoking crack cocaine in the video.{{cite news |work=CBC News |title=Rob Ford wasn't smoking crack on video, lawyer says |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/rob-ford-wasn-t-smoking-crack-on-video-lawyer-says-1.2325017 |date=November 1, 2013}} Doug Ford urges the public release of the video: "Let’s see the video, the Chief said there’s a video and I believe the Chief. Rob hasn’t been charged with anything, he hasn’t broken a law, and he’s been convicted, he’s been convicted by the media."{{cite web |publisher=640 Toronto |title=Doug Ford: "Let’s see the video" |url=http://www.640toronto.com/2013/11/01/doug-ford-lets-see-the-video/ |date=November 1, 2013 |last=MacDonald |first=Grant}} Sandro Lisi is released on $5,000 bail.{{cite news |url=http://www.vancouversun.com/news/Sandro+Lisi+friend+Toronto+Mayor+Ford+court+extortion/9111908/story.html |title=Alexander Lisi, friend of Toronto Mayor Rob Ford, granted bail in extortion case |newspaper=Vancouver Sun |author=The Canadian Press |date=November 1, 2013|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140115023802/http://www.vancouversun.com/news/Sandro+Lisi+friend+Toronto+Mayor+Ford+court+extortion/9111908/story.html|archivedate=January 15, 2014|accessdate=March 23, 2016}} The Toronto Region Board of Trade calls for Ford to take a leave of absence.{{cite press release|publisher=Toronto Region Board of Trade|url=http://www.bot.com/AM/Template.cfm?Section=News_Releases&TEMPLATE=/CM/ContentDisplay.cfm&CONTENTID=8796|title=Toronto Region Board of Trade statement on Mayor Rob Ford|date=November 1, 2013|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103084822/http://www.bot.com/AM/Template.cfm?Section=News_Releases&TEMPLATE=%2FCM%2FContentDisplay.cfm&CONTENTID=8796|archivedate=November 3, 2013|accessdate=March 23, 2016|deadurl=yes|df=mdy-all}} [[File:Councillor Norm Kelly.jpg|thumb|Councillor Kelly, 2012]] * '''November 2''' Ford refuses to speak to reporters and calls police when media follow him.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Sun |date=November 2, 2013 |title=Rob Ford calls Peel police on trailing media |url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/11/02/rob-ford-calls-peel-police-on-trailing-media |author=Toronto Sun Staff}} Ford meets with deputy mayor Norm Kelly who passes on recommendations from Councillors and staff for Ford to take leave of absence. After the meeting, Kelly tells the ''Toronto Sun'' that Ford will address the scandal on his weekly radio show.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Sun |title=Rob Ford to address scandal on radio show: Kelly says conclusion of their conversation to be revealed |url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/11/02/rob-ford-to-address-scandal-on-radio-show |date=November 3, 2013}} * '''November 3''' On his weekly radio show, Ford apologizes for "making mistakes", but plans to continue as mayor and run for re-election in 2014. "There's no one to blame but myself, and I take full responsibility for it. I'm the first one to admit, friends, I am not perfect. I have made mistakes. I have made mistakes, and all I can do right now is apologize for the mistakes." Ford also publicly asks Police Chief Blair to release the video to the public. "I believe that this video — I want the police chief, Bill Blair, to release this video, for every single person in the city to see,"{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |title=Mayor Rob Ford says he made "mistakes" but plans to stay |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2013/11/03/mayor_rob_ford_says_he_made_mistakes_but_plans_to_stay.html |last=Dale |first=Daniel |date=November 3, 2013}} Referring to the content of the video, Ford responded "When the video is released, I am going to explain to the best of my mind what is in that video or videos".{{cite web|url=http://www.cp24.com/news/ford/ford-asks-for-video-s-release-apologizes-for-mistakes-1.1526004#ixzz2jcGAKwy8 |title=Ford asks for video's release, apologizes for 'mistakes' |publisher=CP24.com |date=October 3, 2013 |accessdate=November 3, 2013}} * ''' November 4''' Rob Ford is "uninvited" from the November 6 "Police Chief's Ball", an event hosted by Chief Blair to raise funds for Victim Services Toronto.{{cite news |work=City News |title=Doug Ford says mayor was ‘uninvited’ from police gala, says Blair should resign |url=http://www.citynews.ca/2013/11/05/doug-ford-says-toronto-police-chief-blair-should-step-aside/ |date=November 5, 2013 |accessdate=March 23, 2016 }} :*Ford appears on 640 CFMJ's morning show with John Oakley. Ford denies using drugs. "I can assure you, I can assure you, Johnny, that I do not use drugs. I drink, don’t get me wrong. I’m the first one to enjoy a few cocktails. Some of the parties I’ve had, you know, I shouldn’t have went to the Danforth, you know, inebriated. I shouldn’t have had a pretty, I would say, a wild St. Patrick’s Day party in my office. I shouldn’t have done that. That’s the past. The past is the past."{{cite news |work=Global News |location=Toronto, Ontario |title=Rob Ford’s apologies: Stop us if you think you’ve heard this one before |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/950796/rob-fords-apologies-stop-us-if-you-think-youve-heard-this-one-before/ |first=Erika |last=Tucker |date=November 14, 2013}} *'''November 5''' Doug Ford calls on Police Chief Blair to resign, calling him biased against Rob Ford. Ford asks Police Services Review Board Chair Alok Mukherjee for a meeting, but is turned down, stating that a meeting with Doug Ford would be viewed as interfering with a police investigation.{{cite news |work=CBC |title=Doug Ford calls on Toronto police chief to step down |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/doug-ford-calls-on-toronto-police-chief-to-step-down-1.2415154 |date=November 5, 2013 |accessdate=November 5, 2013}} : A ''[[Global News]]'' poll is released, its results nearly the same as the previous week, with 59% wanting Ford to step down, while 43% approved of the job Ford is doing.{{cite news |work=Global News |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/946497/toronto-mayor-rob-ford-approval-rating-unscathed-by-controversy-poll/ |title=Majority say Toronto Mayor Rob Ford should resign: poll |first=Adam |last=Frisk |date=November 5, 2013 |accessdate=November 5, 2013}} :*'''Ford admits to smoking crack cocaine''' :**At midday, Mayor Rob Ford admits to have smoked [[crack cocaine]], saying "Yes, I have smoked crack cocaine but … am I an addict? No. Have I tried it? Probably in one of my drunken stupors, probably approximately about a year ago".{{cite news|author=Elizabeth Church, Kaleigh Rogers and Jill Mahoney |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/rob-ford-councillors/article15263319/?click=tglobe |title='Yes, I have smoked crack cocaine,' says Mayor Rob Ford |publisher=The Globe and Mail |date= November 6, 2013|accessdate=November 5, 2013 |location=Toronto}} Responding to why the admission took so long, Ford says "I wasn’t lying. You didn’t ask the correct questions". At the end of the day, Ford held a scheduled announcement, reiterating an apology to the City of Toronto. He said "I kept this from my family, especially my brother Doug, my staff, my council colleagues because I was embarrassed and ashamed." and added "To the residents of Toronto, I know I have let you down and I can't do anything else but apologize and apologize and I'm so sorry. I know I have to regain your trust and your confidence." He concluded the announcement by stating he will stay in office and will run for re-election.{{cite web|last=Armstrong |first=James |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/947915/mayor-rob-ford-wont-resign-after-crack-cocaine-admission/ |title=Mayor Rob Ford won’t resign after crack cocaine admission |publisher=Globalnews.ca |date=November 5, 2013 |accessdate=November 5, 2013}} :**[[Vice (magazine)|''Vice'']] magazine publishes an article claiming that Amin Massoudi, Ford's communications director, had hired a hacker to delete a copy of the crack video on a file-sharing site. Massoudi denies the claim in emails to ''Macleans'' and to ''Vice.''{{cite journal |journal=Vice |url=https://www.vice.com/en_ca/read/rob-fords-office-hired-a-hacker-to-destroy-the-crack-tape |title=Rob Ford’s Office Hired a Hacker to Destroy the Crack Tape |last=McGuire |first=Patrick |date= |accessdate=November 6, 2013}} :**The news puts Rob Ford and Toronto in the international media{{cite web|last=Canadian |first=The |url=http://www2.macleans.ca/2013/11/05/anything-else-the-very-latest-on-rob-ford/ |title=Anything else? The very latest on Rob Ford - Need to know |publisher=Macleans.ca |date=November 7, 2013 |accessdate=November 7, 2013}} and that evening [[Jon Stewart]], [[Stephen Colbert]], [[Jimmy Kimmel]], [[Craig Ferguson]] and [[Jay Leno]] all mentioned him on their late night shows.{{cite news|author=November 7, 2013 5:19 PM EST Facebook Twitter RSS |url=https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/2013/11/06/rob_ford_gets_advice_from_jon_stewart_go_to_rehab.html |title=Rob Ford gets advice from Jon Stewart: ‘You need help’ | Toronto Star |publisher=Toronto Star |date= November 6, 2013|accessdate=November 7, 2013}} *'''November 6''' Brooks Barnett, Ford's policy advisor resigns.{{cite news |newspaper=National Post |location=Toronto, ON |title=Rob Ford’s policy advisor quits after crack cocaine admission |url=http://news.nationalpost.com/2013/11/06/rob-fords-policy-advisor-quits-after-crack-cocaine-admission/ |last=Visser |first=Josh |date=November 6, 2013}} Former wrestler [[The Iron Sheik]] appears at City Hall to arm-wrestle Ford as a form of intervention.{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2013/11/06/iron-sheik-rob-ford_n_4227914.html |title=WWE Wrestler Iron Sheik Challenges Mayor Rob Ford To A Fight |publisher=Huffingtonpost.ca |date= |accessdate=November 7, 2013}} *'''November 7''' Another video appears in the media depicting Ford in a tirade in which he shouts "I need fuckin' ten minutes to make sure he's dead!" amongst other threats. The context of the threats and the video are unknown.{{cite web|last=Warmington |first=Joe |url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/11/07/i-need-f---in-10-minutes-to-make-sure-hes-dead-new-rob-ford-video-surfaces |title=I need f-in 10 minutes to make sure he's dead': New Rob Ford video surfaces | Toronto & GTA | News |publisher=Toronto Sun |date= |accessdate=November 7, 2013}} The video had been shopped around to various media outlets before being purchased by the ''Toronto Star'' for $5,000. Ford states that he was "extremely inebriated" in the video: "All I can say is again I’ve made mistakes. It’s extremely embarrassing. The whole world’s going to see it. You know what? I don’t have a problem with it. But it is extremely embarrassing, but I don’t know what to say but again I am apologizing. Again, when you’re in that state ... I hope none of you have ever or will ever be in that state."{{cite news |newspaper=The Globe and Mail |title=New video of 'extremely inebriated' Toronto Mayor Rob Ford surfaces |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/nw-ford-video/article15310059/?click=tglobe |date=November 7, 2013 |first=Jill |last=Mahoney}} :*The Mayor's mother and sister, Diane Ford and Kathy Ford, do an exclusive interview with [[CP24]]; Diane says that it's "not acceptable behaviour", but doesn't believe he should resign.{{cite web|url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/robbie-s-not-a-drug-addict-sister-mother-defend-mayor-rob-ford-1.1532894 |title='Robbie's not a drug addict': sister, mother defend Mayor Rob Ford | CTV News |publisher=Ctvnews.ca |date= |accessdate=November 8, 2013}} Former wrestler [[Brutus Beefcake]] shows up at City Hall to offer to be Ford's "angel of mercy" and is removed by security.{{cite web|url=http://www.citynews.ca/2013/11/07/brutus-beefcake-thrown-out-of-toronto-city-hall/ |title=Brutus Beefcake thrown out of Toronto City Hall | CityNews |publisher=Citynews.ca |date= |accessdate=November 7, 2013}} For the third night running, Ford was lampooned by [[Jon Stewart]] on ''[[The Daily Show]]''; [[Jimmy Kimmel]] once again mentioned him. Dr. [[Drew Pinsky]] (''[[Dr. Drew On Call]]'') featured a panel discussion, commenting "I’m worried the guy’s going to die."{{cite news|newspaper=Toronto Star |url=https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/2013/11/08/rob_ford_take_3_on_jon_stewarts_the_daily_show.html |title=Rob Ford: Take 3 on Jon Stewart’s The Daily Show |publisher=Toronto Star |date=November 8, 2013 |accessdate=November 11, 2013}} * '''November 8''' The Fords' weekly radio show is cancelled permanently, by mutual agreement of [[CFRB]] and the Fords.{{cite news |work=CTV News |url=http://toronto.ctvnews.ca/newstalk-1010-ford-brothers-agree-to-end-weekly-radio-show-1.1534050 |title=NEWSTALK 1010, Ford brothers agree to end weekly radio show |date=November 8, 2013}} Lawyers apply in court for the release of crack video, and further pages of the search warrant requests in the Lisi case.{{cite news |work=CTV News |url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/ctv-news-channel/judge-offers-no-decision-on-release-of-key-ford-video-1.1533509|title=Judge offers no decision on release of key Ford video |date=November 8, 2013 |accessdate=March 23, 2016|last=Mulholland |first=Angela}} :*In interviews with CBC's ''[[The Fifth Estate (TV)|The Fifth Estate]]'' and [[CityNews Toronto]]'s [[Avery Haines]], Mohamed Farah claims he was the person who tried to broker the deal to sell the crack video and says there was more than one video. He says that he was offered cash and threatened by organized crime figures to turn over the video to them. Farah was charged with possession of the proceeds of crime and firearms offences in Project Traveller.{{cite news |work=Ottawa Sun |url=http://www.ottawasun.com/2013/11/08/rob-ford-crack-video-broker-says-there-were-threats-and-money-involved |title=Rob Ford crack video broker says there were threats and money involved |date=November 8, 2013 |accessdate=November 8, 2013 |last=Warmington |first=Joe}} :*A billboard appears along the [[Gardiner Expressway]], in support of Ford; the City announces it will investigate an unauthorized use of its logo.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2013/11/09/billboard_supporting_ford_pops_up_on_gardiner.html |title=Rob Ford: Supportive billboard pops up on Gardiner |publisher=Toronto Star |date=November 9, 2013 |accessdate=November 11, 2013}} The billboard, which misspelled "responsibility" and used the City of Toronto logo without permission, was removed by the afternoon of November 9.{{cite news |newspaper=The Globe and Mail |location=Toronto, ON |title=Rob Ford billboard with two major flaws spotted in Toronto's west-end |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/rob-ford-billboard/article15368327/ |last=Nowlan |first=Sarah |date=November 9, 2013 |accessdate=November 11, 2013}} *'''November 11''' At a ceremony for [[Remembrance Day]], Ford was greeted with "boos" from the audience and scorn from Veterans attending. At least one Veteran blatantly refused to shake his hand.{{cite web|url=http://www.cp24.com/news/ford/veteran-shuns-mayor-at-remembrance-day-service-1.1537661 |title=Veteran shuns mayor at Remembrance Day service |publisher=CP24.com |date=November 11, 2013 |accessdate=November 15, 2013}} A Ford spokesperson says he will appear in the [[Toronto Santa Claus Parade]], despite his assurances to organizers he won't.{{cite news|last=Dale|first=Daniel|title=Ho-ho or no-no? Confusion reigns over Rob Ford’s participation in Santa Claus parade|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2013/11/11/hoho_or_nono_confusion_reigns_over_rob_fords_participation_in_santa_claus_parade.html|accessdate=November 12, 2013|newspaper=Toronto Star|date=November 11, 2013|location=Toronto ON}}{{cite news|title=Rob Ford's role in Santa Claus parade up in the air|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/santa-claus-parade-organizers-say-rob-ford-not-marching/article15380472/|accessdate=November 12, 2013|newspaper=The Globe and Mail|date=November 11, 2013|author=Tara Deschamps|author2=Elizabeth Church|location=Toronto ON}}{{cite news|last=Peat|first=Don|title=Mayor Rob Ford on Santa Claus parade: 'Order the candy canes'|url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/11/11/rob-ford-wont-march-in-santa-claus-parade|accessdate=November 12, 2013|newspaper=Toronto Sun|date=November 11, 2013|location=Toronto ON}}{{cite news|last=Ohlheiser|first=Abby|title=Rob Ford Is 'Not Going Anywhere,' According to Rob Ford|url=http://www.theatlanticwire.com/global/2013/11/rob-ford-not-going-anywhere-according-rob-ford/71485/|accessdate=November 12, 2013|newspaper=The Atlantic Wire|date=November 11, 2013|location=New York NY}} *'''November 12''' In court, the two videos of Ford in the possession of the police are revealed to be different length videos of the same event. The first video is 90 seconds long; the second is shorter.{{cite news |newspaper=The Globe and Mail |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/live-rob-ford/article15390864/ |title=Crown confirms both Rob Ford videos in police possession show same incident |last=McArthur |first=Greg |date=November 12, 2013 |accessdate=November 12, 2013 |location=Toronto}} Judge Nordheimer views the videos and reserves judgment whether to release them to Muhammad Khattak or his lawyer for viewing. Khattak, one of the men shot, had been arrested in Project Traveller raids for drug dealing. Khattak is seeking to make it clear that he was not involved in recording the video or attempting to sell it. :*Ford appears at a [[United Way of Canada|United Way]] fund-raising event at City Hall, signing 1,000 [[bobblehead]]s in his likeness. After bobbleheads run out, Ford autographs t-shirts. Many of the bobbleheads are put up for auction on the Internet.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |title=Rob Ford-themed burgers, dogs, t-shirts capitalize on crack scandal |url=https://www.thestar.com/life/2013/11/13/rob_fordthemed_burgers_dogs_tshirts_capitalize_on_crack_scandal.html |date=November 13, 2013 |last=McKnight |first=Zoe}} :*Toronto Santa Claus Parade organizers send a letter to Ford's Chief of Staff, Earl Provost, asking that Ford consider returning to his original decision of not appearing in the parade, suggesting that his presence would be a distraction "from the anticipated fun and enjoyment that children will have on Parade Day." The letter was read the next day on television channel CP24 by Ron Barbaro, co-chair of the event.{{cite news|title=Rob Ford asked not to lead Santa Claus Parade|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/rob-ford-asked-not-to-lead-santa-claus-parade/article15414127/|accessdate=November 13, 2013|newspaper=The Globe and Mail|date=November 13, 2013|author=Tu Thanh Ha|location=Toronto ON}}{{cite news|last=Dixon|first=Sam|title=Mayor Ford Urged Not to March on Santa Claus Parade|url=http://www.oyetimes.com/news/canada/54123-mayor-ford-urged-not-to-march-on-santa-claus-parade|accessdate=November 13, 2013|newspaper=Oye! Times|date=November 13, 2013|location=Toronto ON}} [[File:Denzil Minnan-Wong speaks to reporters.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Councillor Denzil Minnan-Wong, in 2012.]] *'''November 13–15''' :*'''''November 13''''' :*'''Council asks Ford to take a leave of absence''' :**At a Toronto City Council meeting, Ford admits to having purchased illegal drugs within the past two years. Thirty of the 44 Councillors entered a petition to Council asking Ford to step down.{{cite news |work=CBC News |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/toronto-mayor-rob-ford-admits-to-having-bought-illegal-drugs-1.2424106 |title=Toronto Mayor Rob Ford admits to having bought illegal drugs |date=November 13, 2013}} An anti-Ford rally is organized outside City Hall during the meeting. The Council was considering Ford's behaviour and voted 37-5 for Ford to take a leave of absence. Council also voted for Ford to apologize for misleading council; co-operate with the Police; apologize for letter of reference for Lisi and communicate with Council instead of the media.{{cite web |publisher=City of Toronto |title=City Council Agenda, November 13, 2013 |url=http://app.toronto.ca/tmmis/viewPublishedReport.do?function=getCouncilAgendaReport&meetingId=6813 |accessdate=November 13, 2013}}{{cite news |work=CNN |url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/11/13/world/americas/canada-toronto-mayor/index.html?hpt=hp_t2 |title=Toronto City Council asks Mayor Ford to take leave |last=Castilo |first=Mariano |date=November 13, 2013}} Ford states that "he is not a rat" but pushes for mandatory drug testing for all Councillors by December 1, paid for by himself. Chair [[Frances Nunziata]] ruled Ford's motion out of order.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Sun |url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/11/13/mayor-ford-wants-mandatory-drug-tests-for-councillors |title=Mayor Ford wants mandatory drug tests for councillors |last=Peat |first=Don |date=November 13, 2013}} Council proceedings were shown live in the US on CNN;{{cite news|last=Alcoba|first=Natalie|title=Toronto councillors aim to strip Mayor Rob Ford of emergency powers amid drug scandal|url=http://news.nationalpost.com/2013/11/13/toronto-councillors-aim-to-strip-mayor-rob-ford-of-emergency-powers-amid-drug-scandal/|accessdate=November 14, 2013|newspaper=National Post|date=November 13, 2013|location=Toronto ON}} coverage including a Ford quote mocking his commitment to substance issues ("I said it wouldn't happen again and it has never happened again at the Air Canada Centre"), was published internationally.{{cite news|title=‘I really effed up’|url=http://www.thetelegram.com/News/Canada---World/2013-11-14/article-3479871/%26lsquo%3BI-really-effed-up%26rsquo%3B/1|accessdate=November 14, 2013|newspaper=The Telegram|date=November 14, 2013|location=London}}[http://video.foxnews.com/v/2836274157001/toronto-mayor-rob-ford-faces-city-council/ Toronto Mayor Rob Ford faces city council], ''Fox News'', November 13, 2013. :**Ford appeared to confront Councillor [[Denzil Minnan-Wong]] on the council chamber's floor, both times the Speaker stopped the debate. Councillor [[Maria Augimeri]] separates the two, and Councillor Ford held the Mayor's arm.{{cite news|title=Key moments from Mayor Rob Ford’s hard day at City Hall|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/highlights-from-rob-fords-heated-council-meeting/article15414828/|accessdate=November 16, 2013|newspaper=The Globe and Mail|date=November 13, 2013|author=Elizabeth Church|author2=Kaleigh Rogers|author3=Jill Mahoney|location=Toronto ON}} :**Judge Nordheimer orders the release of the rest of the blacked-out items in the documents detailing the surveillance of Ford and Lisi.{{cite news |newspaper=National Post |location=Toronto, Ontario |last=Boesveld |first=Sarah |title=Judge orders release of redacted court documents in drug case of Rob Ford’s friend Alexander Lisi |url=http://news.nationalpost.com/2013/11/13/judge-orders-release-of-redacted-court-documents-in-drug-case-of-rob-fords-friend-alexander-lisi/ |date=November 13, 2013 |accessdate=November 13, 2013}} The new content was based on interviews with Ford staffers, who detailed drunk driving, sexual harassment, staffers buying liquor for the Mayor, the Mayor taking [[Oxycontin]] and the Mayor consorting with prostitutes. One of the new staffers, David Price, a friend of Ford, was hired by Ford at $130,000 per year, twice the salary of his immediate predecessor.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |title=Rob Ford did drugs, partied with escort on St. Patrick’s Day, police document alleges |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2013/11/13/rob_ford_did_drugs_partied_with_escort_police_document_alleges.html# |date=November 13, 2013}}{{cite news |newspaper=National Post |location=Toronto, Ontario |url=http://news.nationalpost.com/2013/11/13/rob-ford-court-documents-reveal-staffers-thought-prostitute-was-in-his-office-mayor-was-driving-drunk/ |title=Rob Ford court documents reveal staffers thought prostitute was in his office, mayor was driving drunk |last1=Boesveld |first=Sarah |first2= Adrian|last2=Humphreys |first3=Jake |last3=Edmiston |first4=Peter |last4= Kuitenbrouwer}} As Doug and Rob Ford leave City Hall, they warn the press to "be careful what you write" about the allegations.{{cite news |work=City News Toronto |url=http://www.citynews.ca/2013/11/13/mayor-tells-media-to-be-very-careful-about-what-they-write/ |title=Mayor tells media to ‘be very careful about what they write’ |date=November 13, 2013}} :**An Ipsos Reid poll is released showing that 76% of Torontonians want Ford to step down or resign. Of the 76%, 41% suggest Ford retire from politics altogether, while the remaining 35% agree with the idea that Ford should take a leave of absence before running for re-election in 2014. The remaining 24% agree with Ford staying on as mayor.{{cite news |work=City TV |title=Vast majority of Torontonians want Ford to step down |last=Chen |first=Marcia |url=http://www.citynews.ca/2013/11/13/vast-majority-of-torontonians-want-ford-to-step-down/ |date=November 13, 2013}} :*'''''November 14''''' :**Ford threatens legal action against his former staffers and a waiter at the restaurant of the 2012 St. Patrick's Day night party, calling their allegations "outright lies, not true."{{cite news |newspaper=The Globe and Mail |location=Toronto, Ontario |title=Rob Ford vows legal action against former staffers for ‘outright lies’ |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/mayor-rob-ford-vows-legal-action-on-outright-lies/article15436232/ |first1=Jill |last1=Mahoney |first2=Ann |last2=Hui |first3=Tu |last3=Thanh Ha| date=November 14, 2013}} Ford also specifically denied the allegations of sex and a comment about oral sex made to a staff member, and that a woman who attended the St. Patrick's Day night party was a prostitute. "It hurts my wife when they call a friend of mine a prostitute. Alana is not a prostitute. She's a friend. And it makes me sick how people are saying this." He added "The last thing is (former staffer) Olivia Gondek. It said I want to eat her pussy. I've never said that in my life to her. I would never do that. I'm happily married. I've got more than enough to eat at home."{{cite news |work=Sun News Network |title=Ford denies oral sex allegations |url=http://www.sunnewsnetwork.ca/sunnews/politics/archives/2013/11/20131114-072321.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131116111206/http://www.sunnewsnetwork.ca/sunnews/politics/archives/2013/11/20131114-072321.html |archivedate=November 16, 2013 |date=November 14, 2013 |first=Maryam |last=Shah}}{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/11/14/rob-ford-suing-former-staffers_n_4273967.html?ncid=edlinkusaolp00000003 |title=Rob Ford Suing Former Staffers Over Accusations, Makes Explicit Denials (VIDEO, AUDIO) |publisher=Huffingtonpost.com |date= November 14, 2013|accessdate=November 15, 2013 |first=Ryan |last=Craggs}} :**Ford later admits to "driving after taking a drink". "I might have had some drinks and driven, that's absolutely wrong", he told the ''National Post''{{'}}s Natalie Alcoba. To other reporters, Ford said "I’m not perfect. Maybe you are but I’m not. I'm sure none of you have ever had a drink and gotten behind the wheel."{{cite web |publisher=Canada.com |url=http://o.canada.com/news/rob-ford-says-he-is-suing-people-who-made-claims-against-him-to-police/ |title=Rob Ford admits to drunk driving, will sue people who spoke to police |date=November 14, 2013 |first=William |last=Wolfe Wylie}} :**Ford's remarks are made while wearing a [[Toronto Argonauts]] football jersey. The club issues a press release stating that it is "disappointed" that Ford made his remarks while wearing the jersey.{{cite news |work=CBC News |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/crude-rob-ford-comments-disappoint-toronto-argonauts-1.2426664?cmp=rss |title=Crude Rob Ford comments disappoint Toronto Argonauts |date=November 14, 2013}} :**Ford makes a noon-time appearance before the press with his wife Renata. He apologizes for the graphic language he used and asks that the media leave his family alone.{{cite news |work=CTV News |title=Mayor Rob Ford apologizes for lewd language, says he's getting support |url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/mayor-rob-ford-apologizes-for-lewd-language-says-he-s-getting-support-1.1542963 |date=November 14, 2013 |author=CTVNews Staff}} Ford also states that he is getting assistance from "health-care professionals." Councillor [[John Parker (Canadian politician)|John Parker]] states that Ford was using his wife "as a convenient prop". :**An Ipsos Reid poll commissioned by CTV News, CP24 and Newstalk 1010 Radio finds that 62% of Toronto voters would not vote for Ford in any circumstances. In potential municipal election scenarios against [[Olivia Chow]], [[John Tory]], [[Karen Stintz]] and [[David Soknacki]], Ford would place no better than third. Ford's job approval rating among Torontonians did not change at 40%, and was higher in the former suburbs of [[Etobicoke]] and [[Scarborough, Toronto|Scarborough]].{{cite news |work=CTV News |title=Poll: 62% of Torontonians wouldn't vote for Ford in 2014 'under any circumstance' |url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/poll-62-of-torontonians-wouldn-t-vote-for-ford-in-2014-under-any-circumstance-1.1542656 |first=Corinne |last=Ton That |date=November 14, 2013}}{{cite news |newspaper=National Post |location=Toronto, Ontario |title=Rob Ford faces unlikely road to re-election as mayoral rivals Stintz, Chow and Tory all best him in new poll |url=http://news.nationalpost.com/2013/11/14/rob-ford-faces-unlikely-road-to-re-election-as-mayoral-rivals-stintz-chow-and-tory-all-best-him-in-new-poll/ |date=November 14, 2013 |last=Visser |first=Josh}} :**The ''[[Sun News Network]]'' cable television network announces that Rob Ford and Doug Ford will host a new ''[[Ford Nation]]'' television show, starting, November 18, 2013.{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2013/11/14/rob-ford-sun-news_n_4275018.html |publisher=Huffington post |title=Rob Ford, Doug Ford To Get Sun News Show |date=November 14, 2013 |author=Huffington Post Canada }} :**[[Ford Motor Company]] tells [[Bloomberg News]] reporters that they didn't authorize Mayor Ford's use of their logo in Ford Nation t-shirts.{{cite news|title=Ford asks Rob Ford to stop using trademarked blue oval logo|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2013/11/13/ford_asks_rob_ford_to_stop_using_trademarked_blue_oval_logo.html|accessdate=November 14, 2013|newspaper=Toronto Star|date=November 13, 2013|location=Toronto ON}} :**Ontario Premier [[Kathleen Wynne]] announces that the [[Government of Ontario]] is ready to intervene if City Council is unanimous in requesting it, and if all three provincial parties agree. The intervention would be in the form of new powers to be used by Toronto City Council. :**Ford's antics were once again publicized on late night shows by [[Jon Stewart]], [[David Letterman]], [[Jimmy Kimmel]], [[Jimmy Fallon]], [[Stephen Colbert]] and [[Jay Leno]].{{cite news|url=https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/television/2013/11/15/david_letterman_the_top_10_things_going_through_rob_fords_mind_during_the_eightsecond_pause.html |title=Rob Ford: Letterman devotes Top 10 List to Mayor; Jon Stewart, Colbert, Leno leap in again | Toronto Star |publisher=Thestar.com |date= November 15, 2013|accessdate=November 16, 2013}} :**City spokespeople confirm that school trips to City Hall in the next week will be redirected to the [[City of Toronto Archives]], for safety concerns.{{cite news|last=Rogers|first=Kaleigh|title=Toronto cancels school trips to City Hall, citing safety worries|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/toronto-cancels-school-trips-to-city-hall-citing-safety-worries/article15448890/|accessdate=November 16, 2013|newspaper=The Globe and Mail|date=November 14, 2013|location=Toronto ON}}{{cite news|last1=Peat|first1=Don|title=City Hall deemed unsafe for school tours amid Rob Ford scandal|url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/11/14/city-hall-deemed-unsafe-for-school-tours-amid-rob-ford-scandal|accessdate=March 23, 2016|agency=Post Media|publisher=Toronto Sun|date=November 14, 2013}}{{cite news|last=Stanglin|first=Doug|title=Toronto mayor 'sorry' for crude remark, seeks help|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2013/11/14/toronto-mayor-ford-drugs/3529299/|accessdate=November 16, 2013|newspaper=USA Today|date=November 15, 2013|location=McLean VA}}{{cite news|last=Gilles|first=Rob|title=Toronto councilors look to strip mayor of powers|url=http://seattletimes.com/html/nationworld/2022257349_apxcanadatorontomayor.html|newspaper=The Seattle Times|date=November 14, 2013|agency=Associated Press|location=Seattle WA|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150611090849/http://www.seattletimes.com/nation-world/toronto-councilors-look-to-strip-mayor-of-powers/|archivedate=June 11, 2015 |accessdate=March 23, 2016}} :*'''''November 15''''' :**Toronto City Council votes to strip Mayor Ford of executive committee and emergency powers. Ford states that he will challenge the action in court.{{cite news |work=CBC News |title=Rob Ford stripped of key powers in council vote |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/rob-ford-stripped-of-key-powers-in-council-vote-1.2426988 |date=November 15, 2013}} :**Before the council meeting, Ford gives each of his staff a $5000 raise.{{cite news|last=Peat|first=Don|title=Mayor Rob Ford's week one for the books|url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/11/16/mayor-rob-fords-week-one-for-the-books|accessdate=November 19, 2013|newspaper=Toronto Sun|date=November 19, 2013|location=Toronto ON}} :**Councillor Minnan-Wong said he was considering the concept of "asking the province to consider the mayor's seat vacant and moving up the date of the election for mayor", but noted he doubted there was an appetite.{{cite news|last=Peat|first=Don|title=Councillor not ruling out snap election to oust Mayor Ford|url=http://www.sunnewsnetwork.ca/sunnews/politics/archives/2013/11/20131115-202455.html|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131118203747/http://www.sunnewsnetwork.ca/sunnews/politics/archives/2013/11/20131115-202455.html|archivedate=November 18, 2013|accessdate=November 16, 2013|newspaper=Sun News Network|date=November 15, 2013|location=Toronto ON}} :**On Ford's admission of drinking and driving, Newfoundland distillery [[Iceberg Vodka]] releases a general statement describing the practice as "unacceptable and inexcusable behavior." Ford is listed in police reports as having drank the alcohol in a city park with Lisi, Alexander (Sandro).{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/iceberg-vodka-distances-itself-from-rob-ford-1.2428503 |title=Iceberg Vodka distances itself from Rob Ford |publisher=CBC News |date=November 15, 2013 |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} {{multiple image | footer = The four candidates in the election scenarios. | align = center | image1 = TTC Chair Karen Stintz.jpg | width1 = 118 | alt1 = Forumer Toronto City Councillor for (Ward 16) Eglinton-Lawrence | caption1 = Karen Stintz | image2 = John Tory.jpg | width2 = 250 | alt2 = Current mayor of Toronto | caption2 = John Tory | image3 = Olivia_Chow.jpg | width3 = 100 | alt3 = Former Member of Parliament for Trinity—Spadina | caption3 = Olivia Chow | image4 = | alt4 = Former Toronto City Councillor for (Ward 43) Scarborough East | width4 = 155 | caption4 = David Soknacki }} *'''November 16''' Ford is lampooned in the [[cold open]] of ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'', being portrayed by [[Bobby Moynihan]].{{cite web|url=http://o.canada.com/news/rob-ford-saturday-night-live/ |title=VIDEO: Rob Ford gets impersonated in opening of Saturday Night Live | canada.com |publisher=O.canada.com |date=November 13, 2013 |accessdate=November 17, 2013}} :*Exiting Deco Labels on Saturday evening, Councillor Ford sees what he believes is a Toronto Police surveillance vehicle; this incident is mentioned on ''Ford Nation'', filmed the next day.{{cite news|title=Full Episode: Rob Ford comes clean|url=http://www.sunnewsnetwork.ca/sunnews/politics/archives/2013/11/20131118-205516.html|accessdate=November 19, 2013|newspaper=Sun News Network|date=November 19, 2013|author=Don Peat|author2=Shawn Jeffords|agency=QMI Agency|location=Toronto ON|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131121014751/http://www.sunnewsnetwork.ca/sunnews/politics/archives/2013/11/20131118-205516.html#|archive-date=November 21, 2013|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}} *'''November 17''' Ford records interviews with US television networks [[CNN]] and [[Fox News Channel]]. To Fox News, Ford states that "one day I do want to run for Prime Minister" and reiterates he has no plans to step down as Mayor. The Fords also record the first episode of their "Ford Nation" television program.{{cite news |newspaper=The Globe and Mail |location=Toronto, Ontario |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/rob-ford-launches-us-media-offensive-in-effort-to-control-his-message/article15484438/ |title=Rob Ford launches media offensive in bid to control his message |last=Hui |first=Ann |date=November 18, 2013}} [[File:Pam McConnell Toronto Councillor 2011.jpg|150px|thumb|right|Councillor Pam McConnell, 2011.]] *'''November 18''' Toronto City Council votes to strip Mayor Ford of executive and budgetary powers, and assign them to Deputy Mayor Norm Kelly and the City Clerk. Ford and his brother Doug get into a verbal altercation with members of the public in the Council chamber. Ford compares the moves by Council to "invading Kuwait", and promises to fight the whole Council in the next municipal election.{{cite news |work=CTV News |title=Mayor Rob Ford stripped of powers in Toronto council vote |first1=Andrea |last1=Janus |first2=Christina |last2=Commisso |url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/mayor-rob-ford-stripped-of-powers-in-toronto-council-vote-1.1547881 |date=November 18, 2013}} During the meeting, Ford knocks down Councillor [[Pam McConnell]], while his brother was arguing with a spectator. Reports suggest McConnell was left with a fat lip from the altercation.{{cite news|title=VIDEO: Rob Ford bowls over Councillor Pam McConnell during epic council meltdown|url=http://o.canada.com/news/video-rob-ford-ran-into-councillor-pam-mcconnell-during-epic-council-meltdown|accessdate=March 23, 2016|newspaper=O Canada/Ottawa Citizen|date=November 18, 2013|location=Ottawa ON}}{{cite news|title=Rob Ford Knocked Over a Lady in a City Council Meeting [Updated]|url=http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2013/11/rob-ford-run-lady-knock-over-pam-mcconnell.html|accessdate=November 19, 2013|newspaper=New York Magazine|date=November 18, 2013|location=New York NY}} :*Judge Nordheimer denies the request by Khattack to view the 'crack' video. Nordheimer describes the two videos in the possession of the police as separate but "what is revealed in the second video relates back to the first video".{{cite news |newspaper=National Post |url=http://news.nationalpost.com/2013/11/18/judge-dismisses-application-from-lawyer-of-man-in-notorious-rob-ford-photo-to-view-crack-video/ |title=Judge dismisses application from lawyer of man in notorious Rob Ford photo to view ‘crack’ video |author=National Post staff |date=November 18, 2013}} :*After the council meeting, Ford does an interview with CBC's [[Peter Mansbridge]], stating he's finished with drinking. "If you don't see a difference in me in five months, then I'll eat my words. I've had a come-to-Jesus moment if you want to call it that. I've let my dad down, I know he's upstairs watching this."{{cite news|title=Rob Ford says he's quit drinking, has had 'come-to-Jesus' moment|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/rob-ford-says-he-s-quit-drinking-has-had-come-to-jesus-moment-1.2430801 |accessdate=November 19, 2013|work=CBC News|date=November 18, 2013|location=Toronto ON}} :*The first episode of ''Ford Nation'', featuring Rob and Doug Ford, debuts on [[Sun News Network]].{{cite news|title=FULL EPISODE: Rob Ford Comes Clean|url=http://www.sunnewsnetwork.ca/sunnews/politics/archives/2013/11/20131118-205516.html|accessdate=November 19, 2013|author=News Network|date=November 18, 2013|location=Toronto ON|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131121014751/http://www.sunnewsnetwork.ca/sunnews/politics/archives/2013/11/20131118-205516.html#|archive-date=November 21, 2013|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}} Its first airing is seen by 155,000 viewers, with another 45,000 in a repeat Western Canada broadcast, and 65,000 video downloads. It becomes the all-time top rated program on the network. The Ford brothers state they believe they remain under police surveillance. *'''November 19''' A police document released in the extortion charge against Lisi details further information about the video. The document states that Ford is "consuming what appears to be a narcotic" and "the Mayor was apparently in the company of several individuals at the time of the recording" and that the video was made "surreptitiously" in February 2013. The case alleges that Lisi made threatening phone calls to Liban Siyad and Mohamed Siad in May 2013.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |title=Rob Ford: ‘Narcotic’ video made in February, police say |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2013/11/19/rob_ford_narcotic_video_made_in_february_police_say.html |date=November 19, 2013 |last=Donovan |first=Kevin}} :*Sun News Network cancels ''Ford Nation'' after one episode. The production took eight times the resources of a normal hour on the network. Sun News invites the Fords to appear on their other shows, given the record ratings for their program.{{cite news|title=Ford Nation TV Show Cancelled After One Episode|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2013/11/19/ford_nation_tv_show_cancelled_after_one_episode.html |accessdate=November 19, 2013|newspaper=Toronto Star |date=November 19, 2013 |location=Toronto ON}} :*Canadian government Employment Minister [[Jason Kenney]] calls for Ford's resignation.{{cite news|last=Proussalidis|first=Daniel|title=Employment Minister Jason Kenney urges Rob Ford to 'step aside'|url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/11/19/employment-minister-jason-kenney-urges-rob-ford-to-step-aside|accessdate=November 19, 2013 |newspaper=Toronto Sun |date=November 19, 2013 |location=Toronto ON}}{{cite news|last=Mackrael|first=Kim|title=Conservative cabinet minister Jason Kenney calls for Rob Ford to resign |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/politics/conservative-cabinet-minister-calls-for-rob-ford-to-resign/article15512236/ |accessdate=November 19, 2013 |newspaper=The Globe and Mail|date=November 19, 2013 |location=Toronto ON}} The call caused Canadian Finance Minister [[Jim Flaherty]], who considers himself 'a personal friend' of Ford, to swear at Kenney and have to be physically restrained by colleagues.{{cite news |work=Global News |title=Flaherty says Kenney crossed into his turf in criticizing Toronto mayor |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/1032075/flaherty-says-kenney-crossed-into-his-turf-in-criticizing-toronto-mayor/ |date=December 15, 2013 |accessdate=December 16, 2013}} *'''November 20''' An analysis of the Ipsos Reid poll shows that support for Ford has dropped to 16% in his home base of Etobicoke, the same as downtown, while he is more popular in the former York and East York (30%) and Scarborough (27%) areas of Toronto. The data also showed that 44% of respondents without a high school diploma support Ford, while only 17% of university graduates do. Those earning less than $40,000 per year are twice as likely to support Ford as those with higher incomes.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2013/11/20/ford_nation_doesnt_live_in_etobicoke_according_to_ipsos.html |title=Ford Nation doesn't live in Etobicoke, according to Ipsos |last=Oved |first=Marco Chown |date=November 20, 2013}} * ''' November 25''' [[Hampton, Florida]]'s mayor Barry Layne Moore is arrested by the county sheriff on charges of possession of drugs and selling drugs. According to the Bradford County Sheriff Gordon Smith, "This isn’t Toronto. We will not tolerate illegal drug activity in my jurisdiction by anyone to include our elected officials."{{cite news |newspaper=Athens Banner-Herald |title=Florida mayor arrested on drug charges |url=http://onlineathens.com/local-news/2013-11-26/florida-mayor-arrested-drug-charges#.UpUFj3IorFV.twitter |date=November 26, 2013}} * '''November 27''' Justice Ian Nordheimer rules that the remaining content in the documents of the Ford and Lisi investigation are to be released to the public on December 6. The delay in the release is to allow for appeals to higher courts.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star |date=November 27, 2013 |title=Judge orders entire police document about Mayor Rob Ford and Lisi be made public |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/crime/2013/11/27/judge_orders_entire_police_document_about_mayor_rob_ford_and_lisi_be_made_public.html |first=Angela |last=Pagliaro}} * '''November 28''' Canadian news magazine ''[[Maclean's]]'' chooses Ford as "Newsmaker of the Year".{{cite news |newspaper=CityNews |date=November 28, 2013 |title=Mayor Ford is Maclean’s Newsmaker of the Year |url=http://www.citynews.ca/2013/11/28/mayor-ford-is-macleans-newsmaker-of-the-year/}} :*Doug Ford tells Newstalk 1010 that he and his brother are readying a YouTube show, for launch around Christmas.{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/rob-ford-readies-youtube-show-1.2444806 |title=Rob Ford readies YouTube show |publisher=CBC News |date=November 29, 2013 |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} He also says that he and his brother have been approached by American production companies about appearing in their own reality TV show."[http://www.cp24.com/news/ford/ford-brothers-to-host-online-ford-nation-show-1.1566108#ixzz2m6GB6oHg Ford brothers to host online 'Ford Nation' show"], ''cp24'', November 29, 2012 ===December=== *'''December 4''' Transcripts of wiretaps related to the Lisi investigation are released. Taped conversations allege that Ford offered $5,000 and a new car in exchange for the video, weeks before the stories about the video are published by Gawker and the Toronto Star. In other conversations, Mohamed Siad discusses selling the video with Siyadin Abdi for $150,000 to the "Star or the other website." In another, Elena Basso calls Siad to say that Ford is at 15 Windsor Road, and Siad should bring drugs. That same evening, a conversation alleges that Ford is using heroin. Both Rob and Doug Ford decline to comment on the new allegations.{{cite news |newspaper=O Canada/Vancouver Sun |url=http://o.canada.com/news/ford-wire-taps-a-timeline-of-cash-drugs-and-deception |title=Rob Ford may have tried to buy crack video for $5,000 and a car: new police wiretaps |first=Lauren |last=Strapagiel |date=December 4, 2013| |accessdate=March 23, 2016}} *'''December 5''' Rob Ford takes part in "[[The Junkies|The Sports Junkies]]", a sports radio show on [[Washington, D.C.]] radio station, [[WJFK-FM]]. Asked about the latest revelations, Ford describes them as an "outright lie." He refuses to answer any question on the topic, saying they should ask his lawyer.{{cite news |work=City TV News |url=http://www.citynews.ca/2013/12/05/ford-talks-football-pivots-around-pointed-questions-with-radio-sports-junkies/ |title=Ford talks football, pivots around pointed questions with radio ‘Sports Junkies’ |last=Panetta |first=Alexander |date=December 5, 2013}} *'''December 6''' ''Toronto Sun'' publishes an interview with Councillor McConnell, who says headaches, shoulder pain, and neck pain persist, even after spending "a lot of time with chiropractors and massage therapists." Ford knocked over McConnell during a November council meeting. She tells ''The Sun'' that she hasn't ruled out legal action.{{cite news|last=Davidson |first=Terry |url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/12/06/mcconnell-hasnt-ruled-out-legal-action-after-rob-ford-collision |title=Councillor 'lucky to be alive' after Rob Ford hit, may sue |publisher=Toronto Sun |date=December 6, 2013 |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} *''' December 9''' In an appearance on television with [[Conrad Black]], Ford claims that the Police used Lisi as a prop to get him, although Ford declined to explain his meetings with Lisi. Ford also said that he was mad at Police Chief Blair, saying "I definitely think this is political. Am I happy with the chief? No, I'm not right now." Ford stated that he was no longer drinking and offered to take a urine test, although Black pointed out "Rob, there is absolutely no need to do a urine test right now."{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Sun |date=December 9, 2013 |first=Don |last=Peat |title=Rob Ford to Conrad Black: Cops used Lisi as 'prop' |url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/12/09/ive-got-no-problem-doing-a-drug-test-mayor-rob-ford-to-conrad-black}} :*Ford also insinuated that Toronto Star reporter Daniel Dale, whom he confronted behind his home is a [[pedophile]],{{cite news |newspaper=The National Post |location=Toronto |title=Rob Ford, Conrad Black and the death of decency |last=Gee |first=Marcus |date=December 10, 2013 }} saying "Daniel Dale is in my backyard taking pictures. I have little kids. He’s taking pictures of little kids, I don’t want to say that word but you start thinking what this guy is all about."{{cite journal|url=http://www2.macleans.ca/2013/12/10/mayor-rob-ford-stands-by-comment-which-appeared-to-suggest-reporter-is-a-pedophile/ |title=Mayor Rob Ford stands by comment which appeared to suggest reporter is a pedophile - Need to know |publisher=Macleans |date=December 10, 2013 |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} *'''December 11''' Police Chief Blair states that the investigation of Ford was not politically motivated or connected to a Ford demand for a 10% budget cut in the police budget of 2012. Blair is also asked about "Project Brazen 2", the investigation of Ford, but only comments that he "cannot comment on an ongoing investigation."{{cite news |newspaper=National Post |location=Toronto |url=http://news.nationalpost.com/2013/12/11/rob-ford-investigation-not-payback-for-budget-cuts-police-chief-bill-blair-says/ |title=Rob Ford investigation not payback for budget cuts, Police Chief Bill Blair says |first=Natalie |last=Alcoba |date=December 12, 2013 |accessdate=December 12, 2013}} *'''December 12''' Responding to Ford's accusations that he is a pedophile, reporter Daniel Dale serves Mayor Ford a notice of [[libel]], threatening a [[lawsuit]] if he does not apologize.{{cite news|author=Daniel Dale |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2013/12/12/rob_ford_daniel_dale_tells_us_why_hes_taking_legal_action.html |title=Rob Ford: Daniel Dale tells us why he’s taking legal action |publisher=Toronto Star |date=December 12, 2013 |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} Ford, in a press conference, when asked about the insinuation said "I stand by my words, what I said with Conrad Black" adding "If you watch the interview, you’ll know what I said." {{cite news|url=http://news.nationalpost.com/2013/12/10/rob-ford-toronto-star-battle-hits-incredible-new-low-as-paper-says-mayor-called-reporter-a-pedophile/ |title=Rob Ford stands ‘by every word’ despite Toronto Star legal threat over ‘pedophile’ claims about reporter |publisher=National Post |date=December 10, 2013 |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} ==2014== ===January=== *'''January 21''' The Toronto government releases 5,000 pages of Ford staff e-mails from the dates when Gawker publicized the video. [[CNN]] reporter [[Paula Newton]] first asked the mayor's office about the video at 11:15 am on May 16, before Gawker published its blog entry that evening. She later spoke with George Christopoulos about the video. The e-mails showed that the whereabouts of Ford were not known that evening and most of the next day.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Star|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2014/01/21/23_things_to_know_from_5005_pages_of_rob_ford_aides_emails.html |title=23 things to know from 5,005 pages of Rob Ford aides’ emails |date=January 21, 2014 |first=Daniel |last=Dale |accessdate=January 22, 2014}} :*A new video surfaces of Rob Ford, intoxicated, rambling in a restaurant in [[Rexdale]] about "counter-surveillance" and Police Chief Bill Blair. He uses a heavy [[Jamaican accent]] while doing so and appears to utter the [[Jamaican patois]] [[profanity]] [[wikt:bumbaclot|bumbaclot]] multiple times.{{cite web|url=http://www.blogto.com/city/2014/01/new_video_of_rob_ford_drunk_swearing_in_jamaican/ |title=New video of Rob Ford "drunk, swearing in Jamaican" |publisher=Blogto.com |date=January 21, 2014 |accessdate=February 9, 2014}}{{cite news|author=Ann Hui And Elizabeth Church |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/new-video-surfaces-that-appears-to-show-incoherent-mayor-rob-ford/article16433057/ |title=Mayor Rob Ford confirms he was drinking in new video shot last night |publisher=The Globe and Mail |date=January 21, 2014 |accessdate=February 9, 2014 |location=Toronto}} Ford later admitted that he was drinking in the video. Ford refused to answer a reporter's question if he was using drugs that night.{{cite news |work=CBC News |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/defiant-rob-ford-attacks-council-on-drinking-tax-hikes-1.2507140 |title=Defiant Rob Ford attacks council on drinking, tax hikes |accessdate=January 22, 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Donovan|first1=Kevin|last2=Doolittle|first2=Robyn|last3=Brazao|first3=Dale|title=Rob Ford admits to drinking after expletiveladen video shows Toronto mayor rambling|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2014/01/21/rob_ford_new_video_shows_mayor_rambling_slurring_his_words.html|accessdate=March 23, 2016|agency=Toronto Star|publisher=Toronto Star Newspapers Ltd.|date=January 21, 2014}} :*Later in the day, a second video emerged which showed Ford meeting with Sandro Lisi, a friend of Ford's who has been charged with extortion in connection with the "crack video".{{cite news|title=Second Rob Ford video surfaces from the Steak Queen|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/2014/01/21/second_rob_ford_video_surfaces_from_the_steak_queen.html|accessdate=March 23, 2016|agency=Toronto Star Newspapers Ltd.|publisher=Toronto Star}} :*Ford's antics were also lampooned by television comedian [[Jimmy Kimmel]].{{cite news|title=Rob Ford has 'pulled another nugget out of his bag of crazy', Jimmy Kimmel jokes of Jamaican-laced rant: Video|url=http://news.nationalpost.com/arts/television/rob-ford-has-pulled-another-nugget-out-of-his-bag-of-crazy-jimmy-kimmel-jokes-of-jamaican-laced-rant-video|accessdate=March 23, 2016|agency=The Canadian Press|publisher=National Post|date=January 22, 2014}} *'''January 23''' Game show ''[[Jeopardy!]]'' included an $800 clue under the category Scandal that has the following clue: "In 2013, Rob Ford, mayor of this 4th-largest city in N. America first said he smoked weed, not crack ... then, yes, ok, crack, too." One contestant replied correctly "What is Toronto?"{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/toronto-mayor-rob-ford-becomes-a-jeopardy-clue-1.2509639 |title=Toronto Mayor Rob Ford becomes a Jeopardy! clue |publisher=CBC News |date=January 24, 2014 |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} *'''January 29''' In an interview with [[The Toronto Sun]], Ford denies allegations he was involved in the death of Anthony Smith, who was shot to death March 28, 2013.{{cite news|url=http://www.torontosun.com/2014/01/29/mayor-ford-i-had-nothing-to-do-with-anthony-smiths-murder |title=Mayor Ford: 'I had nothing to do with' Anthony Smith's murder |publisher=Toronto Sun |date= |accessdate=February 9, 2014}}{{cite news|author=Tim Alamenciak |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/crime/2014/01/29/rob_ford_distances_himself_from_photo_with_murdered_anthony_smith.html |title=Rob Ford distances himself from photo with murdered Anthony Smith |publisher=Toronto Star |date=January 29, 2014 |accessdate=February 9, 2014}}{{cite news|last=McGuire |first=Patrick |url=https://www.vice.com/en_ca/read/rob-ford-says-he-did-not-have-a-hand-in-killing-anthony-smith |title=Rob Ford Says He Did Not Have a Hand in Killing Anthony Smith |publisher=VICE Canada |date=January 29, 2014 |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} Another story reemerged in the media, relating to the 2012 jailhouse beating of Scott MacIntyre, a known drug dealer, who was allegedly beaten to keep secrets about Ford's drug use. MacIntyre has filed a lawsuit against Ford.{{cite news|author=Greg Mcarthur And Shannon Kari |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/toronto/brother-in-law-abused-in-jail-to-keep-quiet-about-rob-fords-drug-use-lawsuit-alleges/article16590910/?page=1 |title=Jailhouse beating meant to keep Rob Ford's secrets, lawsuit alleges |publisher=The Globe and Mail |date=January 29, 2014 |accessdate=February 9, 2014 |location=Toronto}} ===February=== *'''February 26''' Chief Blair reveals in interviews with Toronto media, that when Lisi was arrested on October 31, Lisi told investigators that Doug Ford would file a conflict-of-interest complaint against the Chief, saying "your boss is going to get his this weekend". The following week, Doug Ford started making complaints about Blair to the media. Doug Ford would go on and file the formal complaint in February 2014. Ford responded that he would add the latest comments by Blair to his complaint. Ford maintained that he did not tell anyone that he would file the complaint, when Lisi was arrested in October 2013.{{cite news |newspaper=Toronto Sun |first=Don |last=Peat |title=Doug Ford threatens new complaint against Bill Blair |date=February 27, 2014}} *'''February 27''' Rob Ford challenges the police chief to arrest him. Ford tells reporters "if he's going to arrest me, arrest me. I've done nothing wrong, and he's wasted millions of dollars. I want him to come clean and say how much money did it cost the taxpayers for surveillance on me and the planes that he had to rent."{{cite news |work=CTV News |title='Arrest me', Ford tells police chief in ongoing war of words |url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/arrest-me-ford-tells-police-chief-in-ongoing-war-of-words-1.1707131 |first=Andrea |last=Janus |date=February 27, 2014}} ===March=== *'''March 3''' Ford is a guest on ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]'' in [[Los Angeles]]. Kimmel proceeds to ask questions and lampoon Ford on his substance abuse, alleged racism, drunk driving, alleged homophobia and alleged domestic abuse. Ford responded to Kimmel saying "I wasn't elected to be perfect". Ford later complained that the interview was a "set up".{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/rob-ford-ridiculed-on-jimmy-kimmel-live-1.2558852 |title=Rob Ford ridiculed on Jimmy Kimmel Live - Toronto - CBC News |publisher=Cbc.ca |date= |accessdate=March 19, 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.torontosun.com/2014/03/03/rob-ford-a-little-upset-about-jimmy-kimmel-show?token=ef18b5b0d2762c7a3ac6a91c0750d271 |title=Rob Ford: Jimmy Kimmel 'was just doing his job' | Toronto & GTA | News |publisher=Toronto Sun |date= |accessdate=March 19, 2014}}{{cite news|author=March 19, 2014 11:09 AM EDT Facebook Twitter RSS |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/city_hall/toronto2014election/2014/03/03/rob_ford_on_the_jimmy_kimmel_show.html |title=Ford on Jimmy Kimmel Live: 'I wasn't elected to be perfect' | Toronto Star |publisher=Thestar.com |date=March 3, 2014 |accessdate=March 19, 2014}} *'''March 5''' Oversight of the ongoing Toronto Police investigation into Ford and Lisi, entitled "Brazen 2", is transferred to the [[Ontario Provincial Police]] (OPP). The transfer is done at the request of police chief Blair.{{cite news |work=CTV News |title=OPP taking 'oversight' role in Rob Ford-related probe, Project Brazen 2 |url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/opp-taking-oversight-role-in-rob-ford-related-probe-project-brazen-2-1.1715394 |date=March 5, 2014 |author=CTV News}} *'''March 19''' Police documents describing the video of Ford smoking crack are unsealed: "At one point Mayor Ford holds the glass cylinder in his mouth, lights the lighter and applies the flame to the tip of the glass cylinder in a circular motion. After several seconds, Mayor Ford appears to inhale the vapour which is produced, then exhale the vapour."{{cite news |work=CTV News |title=Unsealed documents describe alleged Rob Ford crack video |url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/unsealed-documents-describe-alleged-rob-ford-crack-video-1.1736107 |date=March 19, 2014 |first=Sonja |last=Puzic}} :*Reporters attempt to get comments from Mayor Ford, who runs through the lobby of Toronto City Hall to his office without commenting on the revelations. Jimmy Kimmel later described it as a "one-man stampede."{{cite news |work=The National Post |title=Jimmy Kimmel skewers ‘one-man stampede’ Rob Ford after mayor’s hot dog-fuelled rampage through city hall |url=http://arts.nationalpost.com/2014/03/20/jimmy-kimmel-skewers-one-man-stampede-rob-ford-after-mayors-hot-dog-fuelled-rampage-through-city-hall/ |date=March 20, 2014 |first=Rebecca |last=Tucker}} ===April to November=== *'''April 30''' A second video of Ford smoking crack cocaine, reportedly recorded in the early hours on Saturday, April 26, emerges and is reviewed by reporters from ''[[The Globe and Mail]]''. The Globe releases a description and a screenshot from the video. Ford's lawyer announces Ford will be taking a leave of absence from his campaign temporarily to enter [[Drug rehabilitation|rehab]]. *'''May 1''' Ford leaves town, for a rehabilitation program. Initially intending to check into a facility in Chicago, Ford voluntarily turned back at the border and entered the GreeneStone rehabilitation facility in [[Bala, Ontario]].[https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2014/05/23/greenestone_rehab_clinic_confirms_rob_ford_getting_treatment.html GreeneStone rehab clinic confirms Rob Ford getting treatment | Toronto Star] *'''June 30''' Ford returns to office after a two-month leave of absence in rehab. *'''September 12''' Ford suddenly withdrew his candidacy for mayor.
